title: CU organises career summit
body: Atish Dipankar Hall of Chittagong University organised ‘Borderless Career Summit and Starlink Launching 2025’ in collaboration with Area 71 Academy at the social sciences faculty auditorium on Monday. At the programme, important discussions were held on increasing the IT skills of Chittagong University students, the possibility of outsourcing and Starlink’s uninterrupted internet facilities. CU vice-chancellor Professor Muhammad Yahya Akhtar was present as chief guest at the event, and pro-vice-chancellor (administration) Professor Md Kamal Uddin, was present as special guest. The vice-chancellor told the students that students need to increase their IT-related skills. They will be able to earn through outsourcing, and Starlink will play a major role in their uninterrupted internet use. Our cooperation in these areas will continue. Professor Md Kamal Uddin praised the work of the youth and said that the youth worked from the front during the uprising and are still playing an important role in the interests of the students. AGM Niaz Uddin, provost of CU Atish Dipankar Hall said that with the cooperation of Area 71 Academy, Atish Dipankar Hall has come under the Starlink facility which is very positive for the students. In addition, CU Student Counseling and Guidance Center Director Dr. Md. Anwar Hossain and Chaksur VP Ibrahim Hossain Rony were present at the summit. Ashiqur Rahman Ashiq, founder of ‘Voice of Students’, delivered the welcome speech. Rabiul Hasan Shafi, co-founder of ‘Voice of Students’, delivered the closing speech.
